title: Shashi Tharoor Slams Pakistan For Raising Kashmir Issue At IPU, His Savage Response Wins Praise
text:
Congress MP, acclaimed writer of 16 best-selling books, brilliant orator and the god of witty wordplay, Shashi Tharoor is back at representing India in the best way possible on international platforms.

And his badassery is unmatchable, and this time it's even better than the time he schooled someone about the schematics of the economic toll that British rule took on India.

This time Tharoor hit out at Pakistan for raising the Kashmir issue at the Inter Parliamentary Union (IPU) assembly in Serbia, saying 'it is ironic that a state responsible for countless terrorist attacks in Jammu and Kashmir is trying to masquerade as a champion of international law.'

I was obliged on behalf of the Indian delegation to respond to a vitriolic outburst by Pakistan’s delegate at the ⁦@IPUparliament⁩ : pic.twitter.com/17fXHUcb37 — Shashi Tharoor (@ShashiTharoor) October 16, 2019

In a speech that's taken the Internet by storm, Tharoor said, “The Indian delegation rebutted baseless allegations of the Pakistani delegation about Jammu and Kashmir at two different sessions."

Don't Miss 18.9 K SHARES 15.4 K SHARES 14.3 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES 7.6 K SHARES

“Madam chairperson I am a member of Parliament from the leading opposition party in India and we will continue to use our Parliament to discuss and debate with our government on Kashmir and other issues. We will fight our own battles democratically and don’t need or welcome interference from across the border,” he said.

Asserting that Jammu and Kashmir is an integral part of India, Tharoor said, “… it is ironic that a state which is responsible for infecting countless cross-border terrorist attacks in Jammu and Kashmir is trying to masquerade as the champion of international law”.

Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said Parliament of India will not allow these malicious efforts to succeed. “We expect better from parliamentarians then vituperative mudslinging,” he said.

And people couldn't thank Tharoor enough for the way he called out Pakistan. Here's what people had to say:

Sir - Great job, as always, when you represent India on any stage in the world. You are erudite, pithy, emphatic and effective in India putting forward it's views. It's tragic that we don't see you in a bigger role in policy formulation and nation's governance. Kudos. — Parag (@paragp) October 16, 2019

What a reply. Proud of you Mr. Tharoor. I guess the pak delegation must be scrambling for a reply befitting your eloquence. They can't match up. — shyamala menon (@shymenon12) October 16, 2019

My respect has doubled after listening your speech. You can be ruthless to criticize Govt, but as long as you represent the country responsibly, you are true nationalist. Thank you sir. Good to have such leader in our parliamentary system. — Paromita Dey (@paromitade) October 16, 2019





Tharoor said the Indian delegation hoped that the Pakistani delegation from Pakistan would refrain from misusing the forum again and in the collective interest of the parliaments of the world focus on serious issues that are under discussion at the IPU assembly.

The Indian parliamentary delegation is in Serbia’s Belgrade city to attend the 141st assembly of the Inter Parliamentary Union (IPU) to be held from October 13-17.

The delegation comprises MPs from across the party lines, including Tharoor, Kanimozhi Karunanidhi, Wansuk Syiem, Ram Kumar Verma and Sasmit Patra.
